algorithm_technique: 2D prefix sums combined with binary search on the side length
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest square in a matrix whose elements sum up to a given threshold.
problem_summary_technical: Use 2D prefix sums to quickly calculate square sums, then binary search for the maximum side length.
key_insights: A 2D prefix sum array allows for O(1) calculation of any rectangular submatrix sum.
The problem asks for the maximum side length, which suggests binary search on the possible side lengths.
For a fixed side length, we iterate through all possible top-left corners of squares and check their sums using the prefix sum array.
